column2: Demands war reparations from the taget country
We have enacted the Tanzimat reforms.
Patriot rebels dream of unification with their cultural kin under a free banner, and any province they gain control of will eventually defect to a neighboring country of their culture.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in $FROMCOUNTRY$, and have gained control of the capital. They send word they wish to bring all our lost provinces back to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control. Agreeing would mean risking war, but refusing would mean angering our people.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ patriots have risen up in a neighboring country, and have gained sufficient control that they have sent word they wish to bring the province back to $COUNTRY$. Agreeing would mean risking war, but refusing would mean angering our people.
With the patriot rebellion now over, our provinces have now been brought under control and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ governors are once again in command.
Foreign patriots have taken control of the province.
We negotiated a treaty with the Chinese and acquired the rights over a Chinese port and city.
We have lost a war and like vultures, the westerners descended upon us imposing their conditions including the opening of our country, monetary reparations and even the secession of territory.
Our diplomats are negotiating a treaty with a defeated nation.

Ningbo is one of China's oldest cities, with a history dating to the Hemudu culture in 4800 BC. Ningbo was known as a trade city on the silk road at least two thousand years ago, and then as a major port, along with Yangzhou and Guangzhou in the Tang Dynasty, thereafter, the major ports for foreign trade in the Song Dynasty. A walled city sandwiched between the ocean and low-lying mountains to the southwest, with coastal plain and valleys in between, it plays an important role in controlling the important peninsulas of Chuanshan and Xiangshan Peninsula. During the Ming and Qing Dynasties, the textile industry flourished in Ningbo.

The city of Zhuya (Shore of Pearls), name for the famous pearl fisheries of the region, now known as Qiongshan is an important stop to Shanghai and Formosa. Controlling it would give control over all of Hainan and would make an important coaling station.

The Taipei area is where the major Han Chinese settlements in northern Taiwan and one of the designated overseas trade ports, Tamsui, are located. The area gained economic importance due to the booming overseas trade, especially that of tea export. Controlling it would mean controlling Taiwan and a good amount of the tea trade.

Jiaxing is well known as the 'hometown of silk' and it's a famous producer of textiles and woolens. While not being as important as neighboring Shanghai, its acquisition would surely help our textile industry.

The port of Weihaiwei serves as the base for the Beiyang Fleet (Northern Seas Fleet) for the Qing Dynasty. Along with LRshun, it provides a strategic point for the control of the Korea Bay and the Bohai Gulf. Controlling it would put our fleets at the door of the imperial capital of China.

Sprawling around the narrowest neck of the Liaodong Peninsula, occupying the Southern Tip, LRshun, also known as Port Arthur, is in a crucial point. It guards the entrance the Imperial Capital of China and the Bohai Sea. Controlling it would provide a strategical hold on the Bohai Gulf and the Korean Bay.

Qingdao is a sleepy fishing town undergoing dramatic changes - a naval station and garrisons were built by the rulers of the Qing dynasty and the increasing presence of western ships is increasing its importance. It would be an splendid gateway to northern China.

For centuries a major administrative, shipping, and trading town, Shanghai grew in importance in the 19th century due to European recognition of its favorable port location and economic potential. This potential can be fully realized under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ administration.

China is the main supplier of its native tea to Europe, whose annual domestic consumption reached 30,046,935 pounds (13,629,060 kg) in 1830, an average of 1.036 pounds (0.470 kg) per head of population. From the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economic standpoint, Chinese tea was a crucial item since it provides massive wealth for the taipans S foreign (especially $COUNTRY_ADJ$) businessmen in China S while the duty on tea accounted for 10% of the government's income. With a base in Hong Kong our tea and opium trade will profit immensely and the city will, without a doubt, bring us a lot of profit.
Macao lies on the western side of the Pearl River Delta across from Hong Kong. If we are to access the riches of Guangdong and the south of China, controlling Macao would be a good start.

In this part are the ten main markets, though besides these there are a vast number of others in the different parts of town. They are all squares of half a mile to the side, and along their front passes the main street, which is 40 paces in width, and runs straight from end to end of the city, crossing many bridges. At every four miles of its length comes one of those great squares of two miles in compass. In each of the squares is held a market three days a week, frequented by 40,000 or 50,000 persons, who bring there for sale every possible necessity of life. All the ten market places are encompassed by lofty houses, and below these shops is where all sorts of crafts are carried on, and all sorts of wares are on sale, including spices, jewels and pearls. \n $PROVINCENAME$ is bustling with traders, merchants buy and sell opium, making fortunes, and traders from all over China come to trade, bringing  their servants and laborers to run shops or carry goods.

With our administration of $PROVINCENAME$, we abolished opium trade and expelled the old foreign administration. As a result of these harsh policies, trade fell considerably and many Europeans vessels don't stop in $PROVINCENAME$ anymore.
We have recently fired unaccepted bureaucrats to save on our administrative spending.
Fire all minority bureaucrats and demote them to artisans, however this may affect our administrative effiency short-term.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several new grain farms. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the farms and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
We will encourage the grain farms.
No -- $PROVINCENAME$'s current production is too valuable.
They should get to work immediately.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of coal has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of iron has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.
We have reports from $PROVINCENAME$ that a new vein of sulphur has been discovered, and considering the unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$ this might prove to be a boon indeed.

Considering the levels of unemployment in $PROVINCENAME$, local landowners have begun a movement to switch to the production of cash crops -- in this case cotton, which appears to suited to the local terrain. Whether such a plan would help $PROVINCENAME$ in the long run is unknown, but the landowners are asking for the government's assistance in promoting cotton production.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, and many have begun turning to the sea to eke out a living. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support them.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several lumber yards. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the lumber yards and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several tropical lumber yards. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the lumber yards and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.

Unemployment among workers in $PROVINCENAME$ is high, but a possible bright spot is the emergence of several cattle ranches. Local officials are suggesting that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ support the ranches and allow them to become $PROVINCENAME$'s new major industry.
The province has just switched its major production, and locals are still acclimatizing to the change.

The discovery of man-made synthetic dyes in the mid-19th century triggered a long decline in the large-scale market for natural dyes. Synthetic dyes, which can be produced in large quantities, quickly superseded natural dyes for the commercial textile production enabled by the industrial revolution, and unlike natural dyes, are suitable for the synthetic fibres that followed. In a few of our provinces, the production of natural dyes is in a steady decline for a few years and now producers can barely sell their product. Faced with bankruptcy, most dye producers are looking for new goods to sell. We can help them look for new markets.
The age of lategame warfare has begun, allowing more frontage.
The age of lategame warfare has continued, allowing more frontage.
The age of lategame warfare has continued, allowing more frontage.
An End to Natural Dyes in Chittagong

We currently have claims on areas of french culture, however this has put our independence at risk as France sees us as a threat, prehaps we should relinquish our claims on France?

New discoveries and inventions has allowed us to produce chemical weapons for the battlefield, at a cost. \nRRTaking this decision will enable Gas Attack which gives a +1 roll to every battle, but increases land supply costs by 50%, and cannot be undone.!
This decision fires an event which will allow you to free or return cores to your vassals.
Increase the Infamy of All Target Countries by 1
This decision gives all target countries 1 infamy, can be used consecutively to give a specific amount of infamy.
Decrease the Infamy of All Target Countries by 1
This decision reduces all target countries by 1 infamy, can be used consecutively to give a specific amount of infamy.
Clicking this decision will open a menu allowing you to decide how long the sanctions for the targets will last. Use only if someone's been real naughty.
Exempt Vassals from Contributing to our Treasury!

Our coffers are full enough and members of the cabinet have put forward the proposal of exempting our vassals, not the substates, from contributing to $COUNTRY$'s treasury. This tax break would boost our relations with them in the short term, but wouldn't benefit our finances in any way.
Oblige Vassals to Contribute to our Treasury!
The earlier tax break offered to vassals has run its course. We need that every vassal of $COUNTRY$ to do their part and contribute to the maintenance of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ glory.
This will request military or industrial goods from other players, similar to a grant. Please note the sender needs to have the "Economic Responsibility" tech in order to recieve the request.
Our dominant position among our cultural brethren puts us in a position to form the South Andes Confederacy.

With our renewed steel industry, we are able to construct The Statue of Liberty, and send it to a promosing upcoming american country.\nRThe decision will fire an event allowing you to pick which country recieves the statue, it will only give it if the country in question exists and is a player.!

Keep, ancient lands, your storied pomp!' cries she
' With silent lips. 'Give me your tired, your poor,
Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.'

The people of France have presented to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people a spectacular gift. An enormous copper statue, 151 ft. tall, depicting a woman carrying a torch, representing and named 'Liberty Enlightening The World'. The design has been carried out by one Frederic Auguste Bartholdi. The statue will henceforth be known, simply, as 'The Statue of Liberty'.

The first thing people see as they approach our great country, by boat from the Old World, is the gleaming tip of an enormous torch, symbolizing the freedom and liberty of the New. For many of the immigrants to our great nation, this will be the lasting first impression of a country forged and born in liberty, and of a new home.
Take Direct Control over Puppet Units

Use this decision to declare a "fake" war with a invisible country to allow you to take control of puppet units in peacetime, or re-enable control in a war in which it is bugged.\n You will be able to peace out with it at any time with another decision.
Ends the "fake" war and thus relinquishes your control of the puppets.
Send Military Transports to Coastal Puppets

Clicking this decision will fire an event for each of your coastal puppets, allowing you to give them unit transports at the cost of steamers/clippers from your stockpile.\n This decision won't do anything if you don't have any coastal puppets
Clicking this decision will disable crisies for the entire game.\nThe decision will only be visible till 1837!
Change Tag to the Target Country
Clicking this decision will change your tag to the target country.
Enable Host Flag Following Tag Changes
Clicking this decision will make it so when you change tag, the host nation flag will follow to the nation you swap to.
Disable Host Flag Following Tag Changes
Clicking this decision will disable the host flag following your tag swaps again.
Set a Player to Tag Switch to a Target Country.
Click this decision to set a target country as the player to move to the destination tag with the next decision.
Set The Destination Tag to a Target Country.
Click this decision to set a target country as the destination tag, and move the initially selected player to said tag.
Clicking this decision will reset the countries flagged for tag swaps

Clicking this decision will toggle off unaccepted pops from promotion to craftsmen, untill you turn it back on again.
